main.name: William Jarvis-Cross
main.bio: Hi! I am a fourth year undergraduate student at the University of Toronto, and I am completing a double major in Computer Science and Astronomy and Astrophysics as well as a minor in Mathematics. Currently I work for Super (previously Snapcommerce), a commerce company dedicated to cater towards those left behind by credit companies. Outside of my studies, I enjoy learning about the intricacies of our Universe and staying physically active by playing various sports with friends.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to contact me here.

education.degree: Honours Bachelor of Science with High Distinction
education.description: Graduated with a major in Computer Science as well as a minors in Astrophysics and Mathematics.

work.title: Full Stack Web Developer
work.description: Developed and maintained a financial management platform using TypeScript and React, enabling users to efficiently manage their finances. Integrated HubSpot to enhance customer relationship management and streamline user interactions.

work.title: Freelance AWS Cloud Engineer
work.description: Transitioned the companyâ€™s deployment process for a web application from manual configurations to AWS Cloudfront and S3 using Terraform and Ansible to streamline the workflow and reduce deployment time by automating build, deployment, and hosting processes.

work.title: Full Stack Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Built an enhanced refund option, allowing users complete hotel refunds using 3rd party APIs and secure payments. Completely reworked our SMS system by using Twilio and Node.js to build a scalable messaging platform, saving the company thousands per month. Key contributor to the massive growth of this successful start-up. Go-to engineer/owner of the backend (Node) services. Led the process of company rebrand requiring massive effort for the front-end (TypeScript React) services.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Heavily involved in designing software for Geopogo including augmented reality and general game features. Did front-end and back-end work using Unity and C# to create 3D models of cities and a way for the user to traverse the city virtually.

work.title: Software Engineering Lead
work.description: Project completed for UNICEF to build a plugin for Apache Superset which provides an interactive world map with population data that is updated dynamically.

certifications.certification: In Progress - AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
certifications.image: Honours Bachelor of Science with High Distinction

projects.title: Superset Plugin
projects.description: Partnered with UNICEF to create a plugin for their Superset application. It is a modern, enterprise-ready business intelligence web application which takes real-time population data and provides a user-friendly and interactive visualization.

projects.title: MeetSphere
projects.description: Picture effortlessly setting up personalized 1-on-1 meetups that fit snugly into your schedule. It's like having your own personal assistant for networking, but with a sprinkle of magic.

projects.title: Pokemon Game
projects.description: This is my favourite personal project. This is a Pokemon game where the user can explore the world defeating randomly spawning pokemon or catching them to involve them in your team. Build up and train your team to prepare for the boss gyms.

projects.title: Infinity Dungeons
projects.description: Fun adventure game with many different dungeons to explore and defeat.

projects.title: Tron Heroes
projects.description: This is a 2 player game where the goal is to cut off your opponent while staying alive yourself.

projects.title: Sudoku Solver
projects.description: This is a simple python program that solves sudoku puzzles using a backtracking algorithm. Either input your own puzzle or use the random puzzle maker function.
